meanings.definition: A substance that causes irritation or inflammation in one part of the body to relieve pain or inflammation in another part.
meanings.sent1: The counterirritants helped reduce the pain in my knee by causing irritation on my skin.
meanings.sent2: Doctors sometimes use counterirritants to treat muscle pain by creating irritation elsewhere.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally spilled the counterirritants on my arm, and now my knee feels better!
meanings.sent4: Her jokes acted as counterirritants, drawing attention away from the serious discussion.
meanings.sent5: The counterirritants worked like magic, easing the pain in my back.

meanings.definition: Something that distracts attention from an unpleasant or painful situation.
meanings.sent1: The bright colors on the painting served as counterirritants, making me forget about my headache.
meanings.sent2: During the boring lecture, the professor used counterirritants like funny videos to keep the students engaged.
meanings.sent3: The loud music played by the neighbors acted as counterirritants, making it hard to focus on my work.
meanings.sent4: Her cheerful personality was a counterirritant in the gloomy office environment.
meanings.sent5: The delicious smell of baking cookies served as a delightful counterirritant during the stressful meeting.
